name: Alaska Native Heritage Center
description: This center offers cultural demonstrations, performances, and films that highlight Alaska Native traditions, languages, and arts. They have a theater space for film screenings and a "Gathering Place" for live performances
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: Perseverance Theatre
address: 937 W 10th Ave, Juneau, AK 99801 (Note: Their primary performance space is on Douglas Island, but this is a common contact address.)
description: Alaska's only professional theater company, dedicated to developing and working with Alaskan artists and producing plays that celebrate Alaskan culture, history, and themes. They have a strong commitment to working with and developing Alaskan artists, including Alaska Native playwrights
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: University of Alaska Fairbanks - Theatre and Film Department
address: 1215 Cowles Street, Fairbanks, AK 99701 (Noel Wien Library, where workshops were held)
description: This department has hosted workshops specifically aimed at boosting Alaska Native and Native American talent in theater and film, focusing on Indigenous stories and performers
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: Theater Alaska
description: This theater company offers professional theater training for youth and works with schools to introduce students to theater. They have collaborated with Alaska Native playwrights and aim to bring professional theater that represents individuals to high schools
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: TBA Theatre, Inc.
description: An Anchorage-based theater company specializing in performing arts, dedicated to "Training Better Artists Toward a Better Alaska." While not explicitly stated as Alaska Native-owned, they are a local performing arts organization
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: Native Voices (Autry Museum of the American West)
address: 4700 Western Heritage Way, Los Angeles, CA 90027 (While not in Alaska, this program is dedicated to developing and producing new works by Native American, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, and First Nations playwrights and is a significant resource.)
description: This program is devoted to developing and producing new works for the stage by Native American, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, and First Nations playwrights. They offer playwrights' retreats, festivals, and workshops
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: Sealaska Heritage Institute
description: While primarily focused on cultural preservation, language, and art, they maintain a substantial archive of Southeast Alaskan Native ethnographic material and partner with local schools to promote cultural education, which can include performing arts
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: Chilkat Center for the Arts
description: This center hosts live theater, concerts, workshops, and dance classes. It is a venue for performing arts in Haines and supports a diverse arts scene
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: The Winter Bear Project
address: (No specific physical address listed for instruction, but associated with Perseverance Theatre and UAF)
description: This project is dedicated to developing Alaska Native talent in theater. It has involved numerous Alaska Native and Indigenous actors, directors, and creatives, and offers school outreach programs that include theater games
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation

name: Alaska Indian Arts
description: This nonprofit is dedicated to the preservation and continuation of traditional Northwest Coast Native craft and culture. While not exclusively theater instruction, they are a key organization supporting Alaska Native arts and culture, which can encompass performance
services: Alaska-Native-owned Theater instruction in Alaska consultation
